functional.notes: Docs templates exist for navigation, runbooks, and delivery plan. Generation renders them with frontmatter.
evidence: spec/md/docs/LLM_NAVIGATION.mdt exists and is rendered to docs/LLM_NAVIGATION.md
spec/md/docs/runbooks/*.mdt templates cover intent-and-task-workflow, intent-close, intent-quality, requirements-management, logging-basics
scripts/generate_all.mjs: generateAllMdTemplates() renders all .mdt templates with generated frontmatter
docs/delivery/HL_DELIVERY_PLAN.md is generated and includes intent summaries

correctness_safety.notes: Template rendering is deterministic; frontmatter includes source tracking.
evidence: generateMdFromMdt() strips existing frontmatter and adds deterministic generated frontmatter
generatedFrontmatter() includes source path + sha256 for drift detection
writeFileChecked() fails if drift is detected in --check mode

performance.notes: Template rendering is fast; SHA256 is computed per-template (not expensive).
evidence: renderTemplate() uses simple string replace (no regex eval)
Templates are read once and rendered in-memory

security.notes: No user-controlled input in template rendering; path handling is safe.
evidence: Template variables are substituted via safe string replace (no eval)
No dynamic require() or shell execution in template rendering

maintainability.notes: Template structure is clear; adding new docs is incremental (drop a .mdt file).
evidence: Runbooks are self-contained and easy to update

summary.notes: Strong docs foundation; templates are clear and generation is deterministic.
